avalancheActivity.comment: A small slab was reported in Bláfjöll on February 22nd along with small sluffs and cornice collapse.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow is generally stiff and stable.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Thaw on Monday affected the snowpack up to the mountain tops, and a significant amount of snow melted. The snowpack became uniform and has since stiffened and strengthened in cold weather. Small wind slabs may have formed in depressions and gullies since then, due to light snow showers and snow drift. Next Monday, thaw is expected again.

travelAdvisory.comment: <a href="https://blog.vedur.is/ofanflod/2024/03/02/varasamar-snjoadstaedur-a-nordurlandi-og-austfjordum/">Dangerous avalanche conditions</a> are in the North and the Eastfjords. New snow binds poorly with older snow and several slab avalanches have been falling this weekend. Snowfall and rain on Sunday and Monday with warming could trigger more avalanches, especially in the east.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Dangerous avalanche conditions are in the North and the Eastfjords. New snow binds poorly with older snow and several slab avalanches have been falling this weekend.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hæglætisveður og þurrt um helgina, hlýnar þegar líður á sunnudag. Smá úrkoma á mánudag.

avalancheActivity.comment: Small loose avalanches released in the area in sunshine 2nd of March. A few wet slabs fell in thawing weather on Monday the 26th of February.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Small wind slabs could be present in SW-aspects in the mountains.

snowpackStructure.highlights: The snowpack thawed on Monday as warming temperatures reached the mountains. NE snowfall has been falling a little bit this week and thin wind slabs could have formed in SW aspects in the mountains. The old snowpack most likely got stronger after the thawing weather but 10-15 cm of new dry snow is now on top. Snowfall in eastern winds is expected for Monday.

travelAdvisory.comment: <a href="https://blog.vedur.is/ofanflod/2024/03/02/varasamar-snjoadstaedur-a-nordurlandi-og-austfjordum/">Dangerous avalanche conditions</a> are in the North and the Eastfjords. New snow binds poorly with older snow and several slab avalanches have been falling this weekend. Snowfall and rain on Sunday and Monday with warming could trigger more avalanches, especially in the east.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Dangerous avalanche conditions are in the North and the Eastfjords. New snow binds poorly with older snow and several slab avalanches have been falling this weekend.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hægar breytilegar áttir næstu daga og þurrt að mestu. Hlýnar á mánudag í austlægum áttum með lítilsháttar snjókomu. Styttir upp á þriðjudag.

avalancheActivity.comment: A small avalanche was triggered by human activity in a southern aspect on Illviðrishnjúkur, 29.2. Two avalanches released in Illviðrishnjúkur following snowfall on Tuesday, sized between 2 and 2.5. Several small slabs also fell in the area, along with small slabs in Ólafsfjörður. There was considerable avalanche activity in the region before last weekend and during the thaw on Monday. A slab avalanche was reported in Klaufabrekkuskarð, sized 2.5.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Dangerous avalanche conditions are in the region. Weakness is present in the new snow as it has widely drifted into S-facing aspects and formed wind slabs. Travelers should beware of steep slopes and exercise caution.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Unstable layers are widespread where the new snow from this week has accumulated, especially in southerly aspects. A high temperature gradient is within the snowpack due to cold weather and weak layers, both in the new snow and older, have probably grown the last few days. Stability tests have shown fractures with light to moderate loads in the new snow at apr. 30 cm depth. PST indicated that a older deeper weakness still breaks fairly easily, and faceted crystals are present.  Minor warming comes with eastern slush and snowfall on Monday which could compromise stability temporarily.

travelAdvisory.comment: <a href="https://blog.vedur.is/ofanflod/2024/03/02/varasamar-snjoadstaedur-a-nordurlandi-og-austfjordum/">Dangerous avalanche conditions</a> are in the North and the Eastfjords. New snow binds poorly with older snow and several slab avalanches have been falling this weekend. Snowfall and rain on Sunday and Monday with warming could trigger more avalanches, especially in the east.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Dangerous avalanche conditions are in the North and the Eastfjords. New snow binds poorly with older snow and several slab avalanches have been falling this weekend.

weatherForecast.highlights: Logn og úrkomulaust að mestu út helgina en byrjar síðar að élja í A-átt með mánudeginum. Snjókoma heldur síðan áfram til fjalla á mánudag með slyddu eða rigningu á láglendi. Frost allt að -15 til fjalla en hlánar með Mánudeginum þar sem hiti gæti náð allt að 7 gráðum á láglendi.

avalancheActivity.comment: Opp piste skiers triggered slab avalanches 2.3., both in Stafdalur and Oddsskarð. A skier triggered a slab avalanche of size 2 in Stafdalur on Feb 25th. Two other avalanches occurred in Seyðisfjörður the same day.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Dangerous avalanche conditions are in the region. Three human triggered slab avalanches released Saturday 2.3. New snow that has added since Tuesday seems to bond poorly with older snow which has been though thaw. Considerable snowfall is forecasted on Sunday in NE and E wind, followed by warm weather and rain. Then, avalanches should be expected.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow showers the night to Saturday 2.3. added ca. 20 cm of new snow around Neskaupstaður but less at other measure points. Last Monday, thaw reached up to high elevations and after that a little new snow has fallen and drifted, mostly in N wind. Rather thin wind slabs have formed in most aspects, especially in slopes and gullies facing south, and stability tests indicate a weak bond on the intersection with older snow. Considerable snowfall is forecasted on Sunday in E wind, especially close to the shores. Warm weather and rain follow right after. Then, avalanches should be expected, especially in the new snow.

travelAdvisory.comment: <a href="https://blog.vedur.is/ofanflod/2024/03/02/varasamar-snjoadstaedur-a-nordurlandi-og-austfjordum/">Dangerous avalanche conditions</a> are in the North and the Eastfjords. New snow binds poorly with older snow and several slab avalanches have been falling this weekend. Snowfall and rain on Sunday and Monday with warming could trigger more avalanches, especially in the east.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Dangerous avalanche conditions are in the North and the Eastfjords. New snow binds poorly with older snow and several slab avalanches have been falling this weekend.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hlýnar smám saman á sunnudag með NA og A áttum og snjókomu til fjalla. Aðfaranótt mánudags á hiti að fara yfir frostmark og byrja að rigna hátt upp í hlíðar. Hlýindi og einhver rigning í næstu viku.
